channel.title: Upstream Patch Tracking Bug Blocking Haveged Updates
channel.description:
Issue is with the Debian repo but mentioning this here may garner additional support.
There appears to be a bug with the regex in the Debian patch tracker that is preventing push of new sources from Haveged to Debian.
See https://tracker.debian.org/pkg/haveged " Problems while searching for a new upstream version uscan had problems while searching for a new upstream version:"
Haveged has had new updates that released that make it more relavent to modern systems again, and may be useful for Kicksecure.
https://github.com/jirka-h/haveged/issues/57#issuecomment-1002806595 (Merged 1.9.16, Debian on 1.9.14)

item.title: Upstream Patch Tracking Bug Blocking Haveged Updates
item.dc:creator: trekkinjuju
item.description:
Issue is with the Debian repo but mentioning this here may garner additional support.

There appears to be a bug with the regex in the Debian patch tracker that is preventing push of new sources from Haveged to Debian.

See
https://tracker.debian.org/pkg/haveged
" Problems while searching for a new upstream version
uscan had problems while searching for a new upstream version:"

Haveged has had new updates that released that make it more relavent to modern systems again, and may be useful for Kicksecure.

github.com/jirka-h/haveged

is haveged still useful/relevant?

opened 03:41PM - 05 Feb 21 UTC
closed 10:06AM - 17 Mar 22 UTC
klausenbusk

Hi Sorry for the harsh question, but with the jitter entropy added in v5.4 ([â€¦merge commit](https://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/3f2dc2798b81531fd93a3b9b7c39da47ec689e55), [commit](https://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/50ee7529ec4500c88f8664560770a7a1b65db72b), [LKML](https://lore.kernel.org/lkml/alpine.DEB.2.21.1909290010500.2636@nanos.tec.linutronix.de/T/)) and removal of the `/dev/random` blocking pool in v5.6 ([commit](https://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/30c08efec8884fb106b8e57094baa51bb4c44e32), [LWN](https://lwn.net/Articles/808575/)), is `haveged` still useful/relevant? If yes, under what circumstances? \- Kristian

(Merged 1.9.16, Debian on 1.9.14)

Read full topic
item.source: Upstream Patch Tracking Bug Blocking Haveged Updates
